inclusion.criterion: Infected hydronephrosis due to ureteric stone or ureteric stricture.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with a contraindication to either form of drainage (uncorrected coagulopathy, urethral stricture disease, bladder outlet obstruction, pregnancy, ureteral stone greater than 15 mm., or Steinstrasse).
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 62 yo male with hx of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter with multiple prior admissions for UTIs, altered mental status, and urosepsis presents to the hospital in urosepsis now resolved after treatment with vanc/meropenem. Per CT there is a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter, no evidence of urethral strictures.
